required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Bimatoprost Ocular Insert Compared to Topical Timolol Solution in Patients With Glaucoma or Ocular Hypertension
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Multicenter, Randomized, Subject- and Examiner-masked, Controlled Clinical Trial Designed to Evaluate the Safety and Effectiveness of the Bimatoprost Ocular Insert as Compared to Topical Timolol Solution (0.5%) in Patients With Glaucoma or Ocular Hypertension.

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this Phase 2 study is to evaluate whether the Bimatoprost Ocular Insert is non-inferior to that of timolol ophthalmic solution (0.5%) at 12 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Intra-Ocular Pressure (IOP) at Week 2
primary_outcome.description: IOP is a measurement of the fluid pressure inside the eye. Diurnal IOP measurements were taken at 8 am (time (T)=0 hour), 10 am (T=2 hour), and 4 pm (T=8 hour) at Week 2. IOP readings from both eyes were averaged to compute a single IOP value for each diurnal timepoint. A negative change from Baseline indicated improvement.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Intra-Ocular Pressure (IOP) at Week 6
primary_outcome.description: IOP is a measurement of the fluid pressure inside the eye. Diurnal IOP measurements were taken at 8 am (T=0 hour), 10 am (T=2 hour), and 4 pm (T=8 hour) at Week 6. IOP readings from both eyes were averaged to compute a single IOP value for each diurnal timepoint. A negative change from Baseline indicated improvement.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Intra-Ocular Pressure (IOP) at Week 12
primary_outcome.description: IOP is a measurement of the fluid pressure inside the eye. Diurnal IOP measurements were taken at 8 am (T=0 hour), 10 am (T=2 hour), and 4 pm (T=8 hour) at Week 12. IOP readings from both eyes were averaged to compute a single IOP value for each diurnal timepoint. A negative change from Baseline indicated improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in IOP at Month 4
secondary_outcome.description: IOP is a measurement of the fluid pressure inside the eye. Diurnal IOP measurements were taken at 8 am (T=0 hour), 10 am (T=2 hour), and 4 pm (T=8 hour) at Month 4. IOP readings from both eyes were averaged to compute a single IOP value for each diurnal timepoint. A negative change from Baseline indicated improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in IOP at Month 5
secondary_outcome.description: IOP is a measurement of the fluid pressure inside the eye. Diurnal IOP measurements were taken at 8 am (T=0 hour), 10 am (T=2 hour), and 4 pm (T=8 hour) at Month 5. IOP readings from both eyes were averaged to compute a single IOP value for each diurnal timepoint. A negative change from Baseline indicated improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in IOP at Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: IOP is a measurement of the fluid pressure inside the eye. Diurnal IOP measurements were taken at 8 am (T=0 hour), 10 am (T=2 hour), and 4 pm (T=8 hour) at Month 6. IOP readings from both eyes were averaged to compute a single IOP value for each diurnal timepoint. A negative change from Baseline indicated improvement.

arm_group.description: Washout and placebo ocular insert in each eye for at least 4 weeks, followed by 13 mg Bimatoprost Ocular Insert in each eye and placebo eye drops twice a day in each eye for 6 months.
Washout and placebo ocular insert in each eye for at least 4 weeks, followed by Timolol (timoptic ophthalmic solution 0.5%) twice a day in each eye plus placebo ocular insert for 6 months.

intervention.description: Ocular insert without any active drug

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Written informed consent
- Primary open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension in both eyes
- Best-corrected distance vision of 20/80 or better
- Stable visual field
- corneal thickness between 490-620 micrometers
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- Cup-to-disc ratio greater than 0.8
- significant risk of angle closure due to pupil dilation, defined as a Shaffer classification of less than grade 2 based on gonioscopy
- laser surgery for glaucoma/ocular hypertension on one or both eyes within the last 12 months
- past history of corneal refractive surgery
- past history of any incisional surgery for glaucoma at any time
- corneal abnormalities that would interfere with tonometry readings
- current participation in an investigational drug or device study or participation in such a study within 30 days of screening
- Inability to accurately evaluate the retina

facility.name: UC Davis Dept of Ophthalmology & Vision Science

study_doc.doc_comment: peer-reviewed publication of primary results from FSV5-002 study

group.title: Washout + Placebo Ocular Insert
group.description: Glaucoma medication washout and placebo ocular insert in each eye for at least 4 weeks.

group.title: 13 mg Bimatoprost Ocular Insert
group.description: Following the washout period, 13 mg Bimatoprost Ocular Insert and placebo eye drops twice a day in each eye for 6 months.

group.title: Timolol 0.5% + Placebo Ocular Insert
group.description: Following the washout period, timolol ophthalmic solution 0.5% twice a day plus placebo ocular insert in each eye for 6 months.

baseline.population: Safety population included all randomized participants who had ocular inserts placed in their eyes.

group.title: 13 mg Bimatoprost Ocular Insert
group.description: Following the washout period, 13 mg Bimatoprost Ocular Insert and placebo eye drops twice a day in each eye for 6 months.

group.description: Following the washout period, timolol ophthalmic solution 0.5% twice a day plus placebo ocular insert in each eye for 6 months.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.description: IOP is a measurement of the fluid pressure inside the eye. Diurnal IOP measurements were taken at 8 am (time (T)=0 hour), 10 am (T=2 hour), and 4 pm (T=8 hour) at Week 2. IOP readings from both eyes were averaged to compute a single IOP value for each diurnal timepoint. A negative change from Baseline indicated improvement.
outcome.population: Participants from the Full Analysis Set (FAS), all randomized participants who had ocular inserts placed in their eye and who had at least 1 on-treatment study visit completed, with data available for analysis at the given time-point.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: No presentation or publication of Institution’s data relating to the Trial may occur until after the Trial has been completed at all sites. If Investigator desires to present or publish, investigator must submit any and all manuscripts, posters, abstracts, or other intended publications (hereinafter collectively referred to as “manuscripts”) to Sponsor at least sixty (60) days prior to the actual submission of such manuscript(s) for publication.
